title: Pinakbet Recipe
description: Pinakbet is a vegetable-based dish from the Philippines with pork and prawns that makes a flavor-packed, delicious, and filling one-pot meal.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Pinakbet 4.7 (26) 18 Reviews 19 Photos Pinakbet is a vegetable-based dish from the Philippines that can be served as an everyday dish or when you have company. Since it also contains pork and prawns, you can eat it as a one-pot meal. Submitted by lola Updated on November 15, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 3 tablespoons olive oil 1 onion, chopped 2 cloves garlic, minced ½ pound pork loin, chopped ½ pound peeled and deveined prawns salt and pepper to taste 1 tomato, chopped ¼ pound zucchini, seeded and cut into bite-size pieces ¼ pound fresh okra, ends trimmed ¼ pound fresh green beans, trimmed ¼ pound eggplant, cut into bite-size pieces 1 small bitter melon, cut into bite-size pieces Directions Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; stir in onion and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add pork; cook and stir until browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add prawns; cook and stir until they turn pink, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in tomato; season with salt and pepper, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in zucchini, okra, green beans, eggplant, and bitter melon; cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. I Made It Print 70 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 184 Calories 10g Fat 9g Carbs 14g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 184 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 13% Saturated Fat 2g 11% Cholesterol 75mg 25% Sodium 111mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 9g 3% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 4g Protein 14g 28% Vitamin C 23mg 25% Calcium 56mg 4% Iron 2mg 10% Potassium 445mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Pinakbet 01 of 19 Photo by  dotdash meredith food studios 02 of 19 Photo by  shaychavaun 11/03/2022 I didn’t have any bitter melon or okra. I used chicken instead of pork. I added vegetable bouillon, red pepper flakes, cilantro, creole seasoning, a cup of water & corn starch to thicken it up. It came out sooo delish. My daughter loved it. Definitely making this again. 03 of 19 Photo by  MamaMia57 09/02/2021 04 of 19 Photo by  Dawn 08/03/2021 05 of 19 Photo by  Andreotti77 07/10/2020 06 of 19 Photo by  Divino Reyes 05/08/2020 07 of 19 Photo by  khryz 04/30/2020 08 of 19 Photo by  Riena 07/07/2017 09 of 19 Photo by  Jerry Sabio 12/31/2016 10 of 19 Photo by  krza18 10/04/2016 Taste just like how it should without having to use a pinakbet pack from seafood city or something haha. name: lola
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; stir in onion and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir in tomato; season with salt and pepper, cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir in zucchini, okra, green beans, eggplant, and bitter melon; cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
